column1: Just such a farmhouse stood out in the country; and in this house dwelt an old couple—a peasant and his wife. Small as was their property
column2: there was one article among it that they could do without—a horse
column3: that lived on the grass it found by the side of the highroad. The old peasant rode into the town on this horse; and often his neighbors borrowed it of him
column4: and rendered the old couple some service in return for the loan of it. But they thought it would be best if they sold the horse
column5: or exchanged it for something that might be more useful to them. But what might this something be?"You'll know that best
column7: said the wife. It is fair day today
column9: and get rid of the horse for money
column10: or make a good exchange; whichever you do will be right to me. Ride off to the fair."
